info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 1 at 7:50PM MST until June 1 at 10:45PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, eastern Santa Cruz.
* WHEN...Until 1045 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated widespread portions of eastern Santa Cruz county have received between 0.50 and 1.00 inches of rain over the past few hours. An additional area of thunderstorms will move over this area again, resulting in an additional half inch of rain over the next hour. This will cause significant ponding of water in roadway dips and other low-lying areas as well as small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Patagonia, Sonoita, Elgin, Nogales International Airport, Kino Springs, Canelo and Lochiel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MST THIS EVENING
